definition: identity card/also written 身份證|身份证[shen1 fen4 zheng4]
body/life/oneself/personally/one's morality and conduct/the main part of a structure or body/pregnant/classifier for sets of clothes: suit, twinset/Kangxi radical 158
part/share/ingredient/component

to divide/to separate/to distribute/to allocate/to distinguish (good and bad)/part or subdivision/fraction/one tenth (of certain units)/unit of length equivalent to 0.33 cm/minute (unit of time)/minute (angular measurement unit)/a point (in sports or games)/0.01 yuan (unit of money)
certificate/proof/to prove/to demonstrate/to confirm/variant of 症[zheng4]
variant of 身份證號碼|身份证号码[shen1 fen4 zheng4 hao4 ma3]/I.D. number

sentences.english: Could I see your ID and the notice left by the postman?
sentences.chinese: 請借我看身分證和郵差留下的通知。

sentences.english: The clerk refused to sell her alcohol because she didn't have her ID card.
sentences.chinese: 店員拒絕賣酒給她，只因爲她沒帶她的身分證。

sentences.english: I attach a copy of my Hong Kong Identity Card.
sentences.chinese: 現付上本人香港身分證副本一份。

sentences.english: Passport number should be given only if you do not possess HKID card.
sentences.chinese: 有香港身分證的下填寫護照號碼。

sentences.english: Sir, could you show me your ID card?
sentences.chinese: 先生，可以讓我看一下你的身分證嗎？

sentences.english: Passport numbers should ONLY be given when employees do not possess HKID cards.
sentences.chinese: 只在僱員沒有香港身分證的情況下，才填寫護照號碼。

sentences.english: Please provide a copy of Hong Kong Identity Card of the applicant together with the application.
sentences.chinese: 請於遞交申請時，附上申請人香港身分證副本。

sentences.english: The game is open to all holders of Hong Kong Identity cards or permanent residents.
sentences.chinese: 所有持有效身分證或香港永久居民均可參加。

sentences.english: Students who said they'd left theirs in the dorm or at home had a mug shot taken.
sentences.chinese: 那些說把身分證留在宿舍或家中的學生都拍了面部照。

sentences.english: Have you enclosed a copy of your Hong Kong Identity Card and certificate(s) of professional qualification(s) ?
sentences.chinese: 你是否已附上身分證及專業資格證書副本乙份？

sentences.english: Can you let me look at your I. D. card?
sentences.chinese: 你能把身分證借給我看嗎？

sentences.english: Section A2 - Copy of the Business Registration Certificate and Copy of Hong Kong Identity Card of the authorized person.
sentences.chinese: 商業登記證和獲授權人士香港身分證的副本。

sentences.english: They said that compulsory identity cards would infringe civil liberties.
sentences.chinese: 他們說強制辦理身分證會侵犯公民的自由。

definition: identity card/ID
certificate/papers/credentials/document/ID
passport/CL:本[ben3],個|个[ge4]
a pass (authority to enter)/a laissez-passer or safe conduct
identification document/documentary proof
receipt/CL:張|张[zhang1]
Mainland Travel Permit for Taiwan Residents/Taiwan Compatriot Entry Permit/abbr. for 台灣居民來往大陸通行證|台湾居民来往大陆通行证[Tai2 wan1 Ju1 min2 Lai2 wang3 Da4 lu4 Tong1 xing2 zheng4]
to register (one's name)
bank card/ATM card
permanent residency permit (originally referred specifically to the US green card)
to hand in/to hand over
license/authorization/permit
to issue (a document)/to sign and issue officially
to fill in a form/to write data in a box (on a questionnaire or web form)
to verify/to check
population (counted as number of households for census or taxation)/registered residence/residence permit/(in Hong Kong and Macau) bank account
